item.title: Ticket #1434 (need plugin hook for profile modifications) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: There is a plugin hook for user_register, but no hooks for any subsequent changes to that user's profile.

item.title: Ticket #1433 (Empty category hidden even if there are posts in a subcat) created
item.dc:creator: ralesk
item.description:
I’ve just spent some time trying to come up with a reason why some categories get hidden the moment I put them as subcats in a new category. I went through the source of WP (1.5.1.1, so hey, it might not be relevant in 1.5.1.2, but I doubt) to see if there are category limits or anything, akin to the limits of links.

There are no such things — there is instead a feature that empty cats are not shown. However, this does not take into count such circumstances when the parent cat is itself postless, but there are subcats of it which have posts.

Other than that, I’m kind of missing cat-related options from the admin interface, but maybe that’s just lazy me — things like: cat order, show cat numbers, show empty cats.

Crosspost from the support forums — now that I finally found my way here :) I think this is a bug, at least.

item.title: Changeset [2623]: Better headers for CGI enviroments
item.dc:creator: matt

item.title: Ticket #1432 (get_archives_link breaks HTML validation) created
item.dc:creator: ManiacSoftwareManiacsOrg
item.description:
get_archives_link in file wp_includes/template-functions-general.php unconditionally ends link tag with '/>' which breaks page validation for HTML documents.

If it's not very easy to distinguish somehow at this point if the document is going to be served as text/html or application/xhtml+xml then I think some additional value for $format (like 'html_link') should help this.

BTW, it would be nice also to change single quotes to double quotes here just for consistency with every other attribute across pages.
